Following are the node types associated with Swift services:

ul.li: Proxy, Container, Account, Object (PACO) Node: This node runs the Swift-proxy, Swift-account, Swift-container, and Swift-object services. These services run on the same (PACO) node type in the control plane. This is used for smaller clouds or where Swift is a minor element in a larger cloud.

Proxy, Container, and Account (PAC) Node: This node runs Swift-proxy, Swift-account, and Swift-container services. These services run on one (PAC) node type in a control plane. This is used for in larger clouds or where a larger Swift system is in use or planned.

Object (OBJ) Node: This node runs the Swift-object service. This service runs on another (OBJ) node type in a resource pool. This is used for in larger clouds or where a larger Swift system is in use or planned.

section.b: Configuration of Swift Services in the entry-scale-with-vsa
section.p: The following yml files are configured for entry-scale-with-vsa model:

li.p: This yml file contains the Swift information (swiftobj disk-group). This describes what disks on each of the servers are assigned to Swift and the rings that uses those drives.

Swift account, container, and object storage are managed by Swift using a data structure known as a ring. This yml file provides the specification of the rings. For more information on ring specification, refer to ring specification.
This yml file specifies the MGMT and Swift networks. The Swift-proxy service uses the Swift network to communicate with the other Swift services and among themselves.

ul.li:
The Swift-proxy service uses other cloud services as follows. Both of these are configured in the example to run on the core cluster:
Swift validates token by making requests to the Keystone service
Swift caches tokens and other data using the memcached service

section.p: Do not change the network configurations.
